<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">%&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">8</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">%&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">1</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">%&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">14</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">%&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(b)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify">Liquidity risk </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">As at May&nbsp;31, 2020, the Company&#146;s financial liabilities consist of bank indebtedness and accounts payable and accrued
liabilities, which have contractual maturity dates within <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-year,</FONT> long-term debt, and convertible debentures which have contractual maturities over the next five years. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Aphria maintains a debt service charge covenant on certain loans secured by its Aphria One facilities that is measured at <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">year-end</FONT> only. The Company was in breach of its debt service ratio loan covenant for the year, as of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">year-end.</FONT> The Company was in breach of its debt service ratio loan
covenant at year end related to one lender; however, it obtained a waiver from the lender with respect to this breach in the next twelve month period and expects to meet the covenant in the next year. The Company believes that it has sufficient
operating room with respect to its financial covenants for the next fiscal year and does not anticipate being in breach of any of its financial covenants going forward. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company manages its liquidity risk by reviewing its capital requirements on an ongoing basis. Based on the Company&#146;s
working capital position at May&nbsp;31, 2020, management regards liquidity risk to be low. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(c)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify">Currency rate risk </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">As at May&nbsp;31, 2020, a portion of the Company&#146;s financial assets and liabilities held in United States Dollars
(&#147;USD&#148;) and Euros consist of cash and cash equivalents, convertible notes receivable, and long-term investments. The Company&#146;s objective in managing its foreign currency risk is to minimize its net exposure to foreign currency cash
flows by transacting, to the greatest extent possible, with third parties in the functional currency. The Company is exposed to currency rate risk in other comprehensive income, relating to foreign subsidiaries which operate in a foreign currency.
The Company does not currently use foreign exchange contracts to hedge its exposure of its foreign currency cash flows as management has determined that this risk is not significant at this point in time. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company is exposed to unrealized foreign exchange risk through its cash and cash equivalents. As at May&nbsp;31, 2020,
approximately $297,500 USD ($410,000 CAD) of the Company&#146;s cash and cash equivalents was in United States dollars. A 1% change in the foreign exchange rate would result in an unrealized gain or loss of approximately $4,000. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(d)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify">Interest rate price risk </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company manages interest rate risk by restricting the type of investments and varying the terms of maturity and issuers of
marketable securities. Varying the terms to maturity reduces the sensitivity of the portfolio to the impact of interest rate fluctuations. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(e)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify">Capital management </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company&#146;s objectives when managing its capital are to safeguard its ability to continue as a going concern, to meet
its capital expenditures for its continued operations, and to maintain a flexible capital structure which optimizes the cost of capital within a framework of acceptable risk. The Company manages its capital structure and adjusts it in light of
changes in economic conditions and the risk characteristics of the underlying assets. To maintain or adjust its capital structure, the Company may issue new shares, issue new debt, or acquire or dispose of assets. The Company is not subject to
externally imposed capital requirements. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">39 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Aphria Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">For the years ended May 31, 2020 and May 31, 2019 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(In thousands of Canadian dollars, except share and per share amounts) </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Management reviews its capital management approach on an ongoing basis and
believes that this approach, given the relative size of the Company, is reasonable. There have been no changes to the Company&#146;s capital management approach in the year. The Company considers its cash and cash equivalents and marketable
securities as capital. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">From time to time, the Company and/or its subsidiaries may become defendants in legal actions
arising out of the ordinary course and conduct of its business. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">As of May&nbsp;31, 2020, the Company was served
statements of claims in class action lawsuits against the Company and certain of its officers and former officers. These claims relate to alleged misconduct in connection with the Company&#146;s acquisitions of LATAM Holdings Inc.
(&#147;LATAM&#148;) and Nuuvera Inc., and the Company&#146;s June 2018 securities offering. At the present time, the representative claimants have been identified and selected in both the U.S. and Canada. The U.S. claims include alleged violations
of Section&nbsp;10(b) of the Exchange Act, Rule <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10b-5</FONT> under the Exchange Act and Section&nbsp;20(a) of the Exchange Act. The Canadian claims include alleged statutory and common law misrepresentation and
oppression. The Company intends to vigorously defend itself in each of these actions. With respect to the cases commenced in the United States, the Company is self-insured for the costs associated with any award or damages arising from such actions
and has entered into indemnity agreements with each of the directors and officers and, subject to certain exemptions, will cover any costs incurred by them in connection with any of the class action claims. With respect to the cases commenced in
Canada, the Company&#146;s insurance policies may not be sufficient to cover any judgments against the Company. As at May&nbsp;31, 2020, the Company has not recorded any uninsured amount related to this contingency. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">On December&nbsp;9, 2019, the Company was served with a statement of claim commenced by Emblem Cannabis Corporation
(&#147;Emblem&#148;) recently acquired by Aleafia Health Inc. in respect of a supply agreement whereby the Company would provide Emblem with certain cannabis product over a period of five years pursuant to the terms of the supply agreement. Emblem
has terminated this supply agreement on the basis of, among other things, alleged failure by the Company to provide the requisite cannabis product pursuant to the terms of the supply agreement. Subsequent to
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">year-end</FONT> the Company entered into a settlement agreement for total consideration of a cash payment of $15,500 and a share payment of $10,000. The Company recorded a loss on the settlement of $4,345 (Note 26)
and included an accrual for the payment of $25,500 in accounts payable and accrued liabilities. Subsequent to <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">year-end</FONT> the Company issued 1,658,375 shares as part of this settlement. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">40 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">For the years ended May 31, 2020 and May 31, 2019 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(In thousands of Canadian dollars, except share and per share amounts) </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>32.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Segment reporting </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Information reported
to the Chief Operating Decision Maker (&#147;CODM&#148;) for the purpose of resource allocation and assessment of segment performance focuses on the nature of the operations. The Company operates in three segments. 1) cannabis operations, which
encompasses the production, distribution and sale of both medical and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">adult-use</FONT> cannabis, 2) distribution operations, which encompasses the purchase and resale of products to customers. The distribution
operations are carried out through the Company&#146;s wholly owned subsidiaries ABP, FL Group and CC Pharma, and 3) businesses under development which encompass operations in which the Company has not received final licensing or has not commenced
commercial sales from operations. Factors considered in determining the operating segments include the Company&#146;s business activities, the management structure directly accountable to the CODM, availability of discrete financial information and
strategic priorities within the organizational structure. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><U>Segment net revenue:</U> </P>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">2 </P>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Aphria Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Condensed Interim Consolidated Statements of Income (Loss) and Comprehensive Income (Loss) </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(Unaudited <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> in thousands of Canadian dollars, except share and per share amounts) </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>

<TD WIDTH="54%"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="4%"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><I>The accompanying notes are an integral part of these condensed interim consolidated financial statements
</I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">4 </P>

</DIV></Center>

</I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">5 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Aphria Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Notes to the Condensed Interim Consolidated Financial Statements </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">For the three and six months ended November 30, 2020 and November 30, 2019 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(Unaudited - in thousands of Canadian dollars, except share and per share amounts) </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>1.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Nature of operations </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Aphria Inc. (the
&#147;Company&#148; or &#147;Aphria&#148;) is a leading global cannabis company inspiring and empowering the worldwide community to live their very best life. The Company exists under the laws of the <I>Business Corporations Act</I> (Ontario), is
licensed to produce and sell medical and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">adult-use</FONT> cannabis, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">cannabis-derived</FONT> extracts, and derivative cannabis products in Canada under the provisions of <I>The
Cannabis Act.</I> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Broken Coast Cannabis Ltd. (&#147;Broken Coast&#148;) is a
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">wholly-owned</FONT> subsidiary of the Company licensed to produce and sell cannabis under <I>The Cannabis Act. </I>1974568 Ontario Ltd. (&#147;Aphria Diamond&#148;) is a 51%
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">majority-owned</FONT> subsidiary of the Company. In November 2019, Aphria Diamond received its cultivation licence under the provisions of <I>The Cannabis Act</I>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">SweetWater Brewing Company, LLC (&#147;SweetWater&#148;) is a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">wholly-owned</FONT> subsidiary
operating in the beverage alcohol industry in the United States. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The registered office of the Company is located at 1
Adelaide Street East, Suite 2310, Toronto, Ontario. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company&#146;s common shares are listed under the symbol
&#147;APHA&#148; on the Toronto Stock Exchange (&#147;TSX&#148;) in Canada and the National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations Exchange (&#147;NASDAQ&#148;) in the United States. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">These condensed interim consolidated financial statements were approved by the Company&#146;s Board of Directors on
January&nbsp;12, 2020. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>2.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Basis of preparation </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="9%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(a)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify">Statement of compliance </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company&#146;s condensed interim consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with IAS 34,
&#147;Interim Financial Reporting&#148;. These condensed interim consolidated financial statements do not include all notes of the type normally included within the annual financial report and should be read in conjunction with the audited financial
statements of the Company for the year ended May&nbsp;31, 2020, which have been prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards (&#147;IFRS&#148;) as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board and Interpretations
of the IFRS Interpretations Committee. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="9%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(b)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify">Basis of measurement </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">These condensed interim consolidated financial statements have been prepared on the going concern basis, under the historical
cost convention except for certain financial instruments that are measured at fair value and biological assets that are measured at fair value less costs to sell, as detailed in the Company&#146;s accounting policies. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="9%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(c)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify">Functional currency </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">All figures presented in the consolidated financial statements are reflected in Canadian dollars; however, the functional
currency of the Company includes the Canadian dollar, United States dollar and the Euro. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Foreign currency transactions
are translated to the respective functional currencies of the Company&#146;s entities at the exchange rates in effect on the date of the transactions. Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies are translated to the functional
currency at the foreign exchange rate applicable at the statement of financial position date. <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-monetary</FONT> items carried at historical cost denominated in foreign currencies are translated to the functional
currency at the date of the transactions. <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-monetary</FONT> items carried at fair value denominated in foreign currencies are translated to the functional currency at the date when the fair value was determined.
Realized and unrealized exchange gains and losses are recognized through profit and loss. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">On consolidation, the assets
and liabilities of foreign operations reported in their functional currencies are translated into Canadian dollars, the Group&#146;s presentation currency, at <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">period-end</FONT> exchange rates. Income and expenses,
and cash flows of foreign operations are translated into Canadian dollars using average exchange rates. Exchange differences resulting from translating foreign operations are recognized in other comprehensive income and accumulated in equity. The
Company and all of its subsidiaries&#146; functional currency is Canadian dollars, with the exception of Sweet Water Brewing Company, LLC and CC Pharma GmbH whose functional currency is the United States Dollar and Euro respectively. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">6 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Aphria Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Notes to the Condensed Interim Consolidated Financial Statements </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">For the three and six months ended November 30, 2020 and November 30, 2019 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(Unaudited - in thousands of Canadian dollars, except share and per share amounts) </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(d)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify">Basis of consolidation </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Subsidiaries are entities controlled by the Company. Control exists when the Company has the power, directly and indirectly, to
govern the financial and operating policies of an entity and be exposed to the variable returns from its activities. The financial statements of subsidiaries are included in the consolidated financial statements from the date that control commences
until the date that control ceases. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The following is a list of the Company&#146;s operating subsidiaries: </P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Intragroup balances, and any unrealized gains and losses or income and expenses arising from
transactions with jointly controlled entities are eliminated to the extent of the Company&#146;s interest in the entity. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company treats transactions with <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-controlling</FONT> interests that do not result in a
loss of control as transactions with equity owners of the Company. A change in ownership interest results in an adjustment between the carrying amounts of the controlling and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-controlling</FONT> interests to
reflect their relative interests in the subsidiary. Any difference between the amount of the adjustment to <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-controlling</FONT> interests and any consideration paid or received is recognized in a separate reserve
within equity attributable to the owners of the Company. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>3.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Significant accounting policies </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">These condensed interim consolidated financial statements have been prepared following the same accounting policies used in the
preparation of the audited financial statements of the Company for the year ended May&nbsp;31, 2020. For comparative purposes, the Company has reclassified certain immaterial items on the condensed interim consolidated statements of financial
position and the condensed interim consolidated statements of income (loss) and comprehensive income (loss) to conform with the current period&#146;s presentation. </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:11%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify">The Company holds 49% of the issued and outstanding shares of Marigold Projects Jamaica Limited through <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">wholly-owned</FONT> subsidiary Marigold Acquisitions Inc. The Company holds rights through a licensing agreement to 95% of the results of operations of Marigold Projects Jamaica Limited. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">7 </P>

</DIV></Center>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company incurred cannabis costs of $36,744 and $68,705 (2019 <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $14,629 and $30,083) for the three and six months ended November&nbsp;30, 2020. The Company recorded $30,353 and $57,556 (2019 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $12,391 and $19,677) of fair value
adjustments on the growth of biological assets included in inventory sold for the three and six months ended November&nbsp;30, 2020. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company&#146;s capitalized cost increased by $8,669 and $29,267 for the three and six months ended November&nbsp;30, 2020.
The increase in capitalized costs is made up of the following: cannabis related inventory increased by $4,599 and $19,620, beverage alcohol inventory increased by $6,622 and $6,622 and distribution inventory increased (decreased) by $(2,552) and
$3,025 for the three and six months ended November&nbsp;30, 2020. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

are comprised of</U>: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">8 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Aphria Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Notes to the Condensed Interim Consolidated Financial Statements </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">For the three and six months ended November 30, 2020 and November 30, 2019 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(Unaudited - in thousands of Canadian dollars, except share and per share amounts) </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company values cannabis plants at cost, which approximates fair value
from the date of initial clipping from mother plants until <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">half-way</FONT> through the flowering cycle of the plants. Measurement of the biological transformation of the plant at fair value less costs to sell begins
in the fourth week prior to harvest and is recognized evenly until the point of harvest. The number of weeks in the growing cycle is between twelve and sixteen weeks from propagation to harvest. The Company has determined the fair value less costs
to sell of cannabis to be between $2.40 and $2.90 per gram, upon harvest for greenhouse produced cannabis (May 31, 2020 &#150; $3.00 per gram) and between $3.50 and $4.00 per gram (May 31, 2020 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $4.00 per
gram), upon harvest for indoor produced cannabis. The Company has determined the fair value increment on cannabis trim to be $nil per gram (May 31, 2020 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $0.01 per gram). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The effect of the fair value less cost to sell over and above historical cost was an increase in
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> value of biological assets and inventory of $26,092 and $85,242 during the three and six months ended November&nbsp;30, 2020 (2019 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $21,492 and $46,645). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The fair value of biological assets is determined using a valuation model to estimate expected harvest yield per plant applied
to the estimated price per gram less processing and selling costs. Only when there is a material change from the expected fair value used for cannabis does the Company make any adjustments to the fair value used. During the period, the Company
amended the fair value based on an expected lower average selling price with the release of the Company&#146;s economy brands, which the Company is using to create demand for lower potency harvested cannabis. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">In determining the fair value of biological assets, management has made the following estimates in this valuation model: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="14%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">The harvest yield is between 20 grams and 60 grams per plant; </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="14%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">The selling price is between $1.50 and $6.50 per gram of cannabis; </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="14%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">Processing costs include drying and curing, testing, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">post-harvest</FONT>
overhead allocation, packaging and labelling costs between $0.30 and $0.80 per gram; </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="14%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">Selling costs include shipping, order fulfilment, patient acquisition and patient maintenance costs between
$0.00 and $1.50 per gram; </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Sales prices used in the valuation of biological assets is based on the
average selling price of all cannabis products and can vary based on different strains being grown as well as the proportion of sales derived from wholesale compared to retail. Selling costs vary depending on methods of selling and are considered
based on the expected method of selling and the determined additional costs which would be incurred. Expected yields for the cannabis plant is also subject to a variety of factors, such as strains being grown, length of growing cycle, and space
allocated for growing. Management reviews all significant inputs based on historical information obtained as well as based on planned production schedules. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Management has quantified the sensitivity of the inputs and determined the following: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="14%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">Selling price per gram &#150; a decrease in the average selling price per gram by 5% would result in the
biological asset value decreasing by $822 (May 31, 2020 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $682) and inventory decreasing by $12,312 (May 31, 2020 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $9,895) </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="14%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">Harvest yield per plant &#150; a decrease in the harvest yield per plant of 5% would result in the biological
asset value decreasing by $490 (May 31, 2020 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $439) </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">These
inputs are level 3 on the fair value hierarchy and are subject to volatility in market prices and several uncontrollable factors, which could significantly affect the fair value of biological assets in future periods. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">9 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Aphria Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Notes to the Condensed Interim Consolidated Financial Statements </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">For the three and six months ended November 30, 2020 and November 30, 2019 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(Unaudited - in thousands of Canadian dollars, except share and per share amounts) </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>7.</B></TD>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Directors and officers of the Company control 0.10% or 332,377 of the voting shares of the
Company. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">As at November&nbsp;30, 2020, a balance paid to an officer and director of the Company of $445 is included within
prepaid and other current assets. During the period, the Company issued 150,000 deferred share units to directors of the Company under the terms of the Company&#146;s Omnibus <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Long-Term</FONT> Incentive Plan. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">During the period, the Company issued 866,190 restricted share units to officers and directors of the Company under the terms
of the Company&#146;s Omnibus <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Long-Term</FONT> Incentive Plan, all of which vest over two years. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">During the period, the Company issued 50,000 stock options to officers of the Company, under the terms of the Company&#146;s
Omnibus <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Long-Term</FONT> Incentive Plan. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">10 </P>

</DIV></Center>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Included in Licences, permits&nbsp;&amp; applications is $254,216 of indefinite lived
intangible assets. During the period, the Company disposed of $8,193 of trademarks for proceeds of $8,193. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>10.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Business Acquisition </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><I><U>Acquisition of
SW Brewing Company, LLC</U></I> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">On November&nbsp;25, 2020, the Company, through its
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">wholly-owned</FONT> subsidiary Four Twenty Corpora on, completed the purchase of all the shares of SW Brewing Company, LLC which is the holding company of 100% of the common shares of SweetWater. The purchase price
consisted of cash consideration of $256,559 USD ($333,604 CAD), share consideration of 9,823,183 shares, and additional cash consideration of up to $66,000 USD contingent on SweetWater achieving specified EBITDA targets. The fair value of the shares
on the date the Company closed the acquisition was $85,796, the fair value of the contingent consideration on the date the Company closed the acquisition was $58,959 USD ($76,664 CAD). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company is in the process of assessing the fair value of the net assets acquired and, as a result, the fair value of the
net assets acquired may be subject to adjustments pending completion of final valuations and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">post-closing</FONT> adjustments. The table below summarizes preliminary estimated fair value of the assets acquired and the
liabilities assumed at the effective acquisition date. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">12 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Aphria Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Notes to the Condensed Interim Consolidated Financial Statements </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">For the three and six months ended November 30, 2020 and November 30, 2019 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(Unaudited - in thousands of Canadian dollars, except share and per share amounts) </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><B>9,371</B></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><B>&nbsp;</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">14,626</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff" STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Deduct <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> current portion</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><B>&nbsp;</B></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><B>(9,371</B></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><B>)&nbsp;</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">(14,626</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">)&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1px; ">
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><B>$</B></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><B>&#151;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><B>&nbsp;</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">$</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">&#151;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1px; ">
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>HydRx Farms Ltd. (d/b/a Scientus Pharma) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">On August&nbsp;14, 2017, Aphria purchased $11,500 in secured convertible debentures of Scientus Pharma (&#147;SP&#148;). The
convertible debentures bore interest at 8%, paid <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">semi-annually,</FONT> matured in two years and included the right to convert the debentures into common shares of SP at $2.75 per common share at any time before
maturity. During the period, the Company settled the note receivable for $5,000. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>10330698 Canada Ltd. (d/b/a Starbuds)
</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">On December&nbsp;28, 2018, Aphria purchased $5,000 in secured convertible debentures of Starbuds. The convertible
debentures bear interest at 8.5% per annum accruing daily due until maturity on December&nbsp;28, 2020. The debentures are secured against the assets of Starbuds. The debentures and any accrued and unpaid interest are convertible into common shares
for $0.50 per common share and matured on December&nbsp;28, 2020. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">As at November&nbsp;30, 2020, the fair value of the
Company&#146;s secured convertible debentures was $5,348 (May 31, 2020 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $4,728), which includes $429 (May 31, 2020 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $216) of accrued interest. The remaining change
resulted in a fair value gain (loss) for the three and six months ended November&nbsp;30, 2020 of $224 and $407 (2019 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $(1,413) and (1,025)). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>High Tide Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">On April&nbsp;10, 2019, Aphria purchased $4,500 in unsecured convertible debentures of High Tide Inc. (&#147;High Tide&#148;).
The convertible debentures bear interest at 10% per annum, payable annually up front in common shares of High Tide based on the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-day</FONT> volume weighted average price (the &#147;Debentures&#148;). The debentures
mature on April&nbsp;10, 2021 and are convertible into common shares of High Tide at a price of $0.75 at the option of the holder. In addition to the debentures, the Company received 6,000,000 warrants in High Tide as part of the purchase of the
unsecured convertible debentures (Note 12). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">As at November&nbsp;30, 2020, the fair value of the unsecured convertible
debentures was $4,023 (May 31, 2020 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $3,898), which resulted in a fair value gain (loss) for the three and six months ended November&nbsp;30, 2020 of $66 and $125 (2019
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $(252) and (174)). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Convertible notes receivable </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The unrealized gain (loss) on convertible notes receivable recognized in the results of operations amounts to $290 and $(468)
for the three and six months ended November&nbsp;30, 2020 (2019 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $(8,094) and $(6,939)). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The fair value was determined using the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Black-Scholes</FONT> option pricing model using the
following assumptions: the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">risk-free</FONT> rate of 1.25%; expected life of the convertible note; volatility of 70% based on comparable companies; forfeiture rate of nil; dividend yield of nil; and, the exercise
price of the respective conversion feature. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">14 </P>

</DIV></Center>

<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company owns 26,900,000 common shares and 6,900,000 warrants at a cost of $19,057, with a fair value of $4,842 as at
November&nbsp;30, 2020. Each warrant is exercisable at $1.29 per warrant expiring November&nbsp;1, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Aleafia
Health Inc. (formerly Emblem Corp.) (&#147;Aleafia&#148;) </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">During the period, the Company sold 5,823,831 common shares
in Aleafia, for proceeds of $3,066 resulting in a loss of $254 (Note 28). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Rapid Dose Therapeutics Inc.
(&#147;RDT&#148;)</B> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company owns 6,918,500 common shares, for a total cost of $5,189, with a fair value of $2,076 as
at November&nbsp;30, 2020. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Fire&nbsp;&amp; Flower Inc.</B> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">During the period, the Company sold 334,525 common shares, for proceeds of $252 resulting in a gain of $15 (Note 28). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>High Tide Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company owns 943,396 common shares and 6,000,000 warrants in High Tide Inc. at a cost of $450, with a fair value of $179 as
at November&nbsp;30, 2020. Each warrant is exercisable at $0.85 per warrant expiring April&nbsp;18, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Althea Group
Holdings Ltd. (&#147;Althea&#148;) </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company owns 12,250,000 common shares of Althea at a cost of $2,348 AUD ($2,206
CAD) with a fair value of $5,022 AUD ($4,817 CAD) as at November&nbsp;30, 2020. Subsequent to <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">quarter-end,</FONT> the Company sold the remaining shares in Althea for proceeds of $5,022 AUD. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Resolve Digital Health Inc. (&#147;Resolve&#148;) </B></P>

as at November&nbsp;30, 2020. The Company determined the fair value of its investment based on its net realizable value. Each warrant is exercisable at $0.65 per warrant expiring December&nbsp;1, 2021. </P>

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Aphria Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Notes to the Condensed Interim Consolidated Financial Statements </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">For the three and six months ended November 30, 2020 and November 30, 2019 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(Unaudited - in thousands of Canadian dollars, except share and per share amounts) </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Green Acre Capital Fund I </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company invested $2,000 to Green Acre Capital Fund I. The Company determined the fair value of its investment, based on its
proportionate share of net assets, to be $2,200 as at November&nbsp;30, 2020. The Company has received $1,560 return of capital since its initial contribution. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Weekend Holdings Corp. (formerly Green Tank Holdings Corp.) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company owns 2,040,218 shares in Weekend Holdings Corp. for a total cost of $1,420 USD ($1,890 CAD), with a fair value of
$1,000 USD ($1,299 CAD) as at November&nbsp;30, 2020. The Company determined the fair value of its investment based on its net realizable value. The Company recognized a loss from the change in fair value of $80 due to changes in the foreign
exchange rate. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>IBBZ Krankenhaus GmbH Klinik Hygiea (&#147;Krankenhaus&#148;) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company owns 25.1% of Krankenhaus, which is the owner and operator of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Berlin-based</FONT>
Sch&ouml;neberg Hospital, for &#128;1,294 ($1,956 CAD). Through this investment, the Company is entitled to 5% of the net income (loss) for the years 2018 to 2021, and 10% of the net income (loss) for the period thereafter. Subsequent to quarter
end, the Company sold its ownership of Krankenhaus for &#128;400. The Company determined that the fair value of its investment, based on its recoverable value. The Company recognized a loss from the change in fair value of $1,372. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Greenwell Brands GmbH (&#147;Greenwell&#148;) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">In September 2018, the Company entered into an investment and shareholder agreement with Greenwell for the purchase of 1,250
common shares, for a total cost of &#128;100 ($152 CAD). The Company determined that the fair value of its investment, based on the most recent financing at the same price, is equal to its carrying value. The Company recognized a gain from the
change in fair value of $2 due to changes in the foreign exchange rate. <B> </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>HighArchy Ventures Ltd.</B>
(&#147;<B>HighArchy</B>&#148;) </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company owns 9,453,168 shares, and has an option to
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-acquire</FONT> control of 10,536,832 shares in HighArchy for a total cost of $9,995, with a fair value of $4,997 as at November&nbsp;30, 2020. The Company determined the fair value of its investment based on its
net realizable value. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Schroll Medical ApS </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company has contributed capital of &#128;403 ($605 CAD) and owns 3,000 shares in Schroll Medical ApS. The Company
determined that the fair value of its investment, based on the most recent financing at the same price, is equal to its carrying value. The Company recognized a gain from the change in fair value of $10 due to changes in the foreign exchange rate.

<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company secured an
operating line of credit in the amount of $1,000 which bears interest at the lender&#146;s prime rate plus 75 basis points. As at November&nbsp;30, 2020, the Company has not drawn on the line of credit. The operating line of credit is secured by a
first charge on the property at 265 Talbot Street West, Leamington, Ontario and a first ranking position on a general security agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company&#146;s subsidiary, CC Pharma, has two operating lines of credit for &#128;3,500 each, which bear interest at Euro
Over Night Index Average plus 1.79% and Euro Interbank Offered Rate plus 3.682% . As at November&nbsp;30, 2020, a total of &#128;3,286 ($5,110 CAD) was drawn down from the available credit of &#128;7,000. The operating lines of credit are secured by
a first charge on the inventory held by CC Pharma. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The contingent consideration is a fair value measurement and as such is carried at fair value.
The fair value has been determined by discounting future expected cash outflows at a discount rate of 5%. The inputs into the future expected cash outflows are level 3 on the fair value hierarchy and are subject to volatility and uncertainty, which
could significantly affect the fair value of the contingent consideration in future periods. </P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The credit facility of $80,000 was entered into on November&nbsp;29, 2019 by 51% owned
subsidiary Aphria Diamond and is secured by a first charge on the property at 620 County Road 14, Leamington, Ontario, owned by Aphria Diamond, and a guarantee from Aphria Inc. Principal payments start on the credit facility in March 2021. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The term loan of $17,821 was entered into on July&nbsp;27, 2018 and is secured by a first charge on the property at 223, 231,
239, 265, 269, 271 and 275 Talbot Street West, Leamington Ontario, a first position on a general security agreement, and an assignment of fire insurance to the lender. Principal payments started on the term loan in August 2018. The effective
interest rate during the year was 4.68%. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">19 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Aphria Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Notes to the Condensed Interim Consolidated Financial Statements </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">For the three and six months ended November 30, 2020 and November 30, 2019 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(Unaudited - in thousands of Canadian dollars, except share and per share amounts) </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The term loan of $21,386 was entered into on May&nbsp;9, 2017 and is secured
by a first charge on the property at 265 Talbot Street West, Leamington Ontario, a first position on a general security agreement, and an assignment of fire insurance to the lender. Principal payments started on the term loan in March 2018. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The term loan of $770 and mortgage payable of $3,167 were entered into on July&nbsp;22, 2016 and are secured by a first charge
on the property at 265 Talbot Street West, Leamington, Ontario and a first position on a general security agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The
vendor <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">take-back</FONT> mortgage payable of $438 was entered into on June&nbsp;30, 2016 in conjunction with the acquisition of the property at 265 Talbot Street West. The mortgage is secured by a second charge on the
property at 265 Talbot Street West, Leamington, Ontario. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">During the period, the Company entered into a term loan for
&#128;1,500 ($2,332 CAD) through <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">wholly-owned</FONT> subsidiary CC Pharma. The term loans for &#128;9,500 ($14,772 CAD) are held through <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">wholly-owned</FONT> subsidiary CC Pharma.
These term loans are secured against the distribution inventory held by CC Pharma. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>17.</B></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Closing balance</B></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><B>$</B></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><B>358,008</B></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><B>&nbsp;</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">$</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">270,783</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1px; ">
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The unsecured convertible debentures were entered into in April 2019, in the principal amount
of $350,000 USD, are due in five years from issuance (the &#147;Notes&#148;). The Notes bear interest at a rate of 5.25% per annum, payable semi-annually in arrears on June 1 and December 1 of each year, beginning on December 1, 2019. The Notes are
an unsecured obligation and ranked senior in right of payment to all indebtedness that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Notes. The Notes will rank equal in right of payment with all liabilities that are not subordinated. The
Notes are effectively junior to any secured indebtedness to the extent of the value of the assets securing such indebtedness. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Holders of the Notes may convert all or any portion of their Notes, in multiples of $1 USD principal amount, at their option at
any time between December&nbsp;1, 2023 to the maturity date. The initial conversion rate for the Notes will be 106.5644 common shares of Aphria per $1 USD principal amount of Notes, which will be settled in cash, common shares of Aphria or a
combination thereof, at Aphria&#146;s election. This is equivalent to an initial conversion price of approximately $9.38 per common share, subject to adjustments in certain events. In addition, holders of the Notes may convert all or any portion of
their Notes, in multiples of $1 USD principal amount, at their option at any time preceding December&nbsp;1, 2023, if: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(a)&nbsp;the last reported sales price of the common shares for at least 20 trading days during a period of 30 consecutive
trading days immediately preceding fiscal quarter is greater than or equal to 130% of the conversion price on each applicable trading day; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(b)&nbsp;during the five business day period after any five consecutive trading day period (the &#147;measurement period&#148;)
in which the trading price per $1 USD principal amount of the Notes for each trading day of the measurement period is less than 98% of the product of the last reported sale price of the Company&#146;s common shares and the conversion rate on each
such trading day; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(c)&nbsp;the Company calls any or all of the Notes for redemption or; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">(d)&nbsp;upon occurrence of specified corporate event. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Company may not redeem the Notes prior to June&nbsp;6, 2022, except upon the occurrence of certain changes in tax laws. On
or after June&nbsp;6, 2022, the Company may redeem for cash all or part of the Notes, at its option, if the last reported sale price of the Company&#146;s common shares has been at least 130% of the conversion price then in effect for at least 20
trading days during any 30 consecutive trading day period ending on and including trading day immediately preceding the date on which the Company provides notice of redemption. The redemption of Notes will be equal to 100% of the principal amount
plus accrued and unpaid interest to, but excluding, the redemption date. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">As at November&nbsp;30, 2020 there was $259,240
USD principal outstanding (May 31, 2020 <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-</FONT> $259,240 USD). </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">20 </P>

</DIV></Center>

<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">at-the-market</FONT></FONT> financing for net proceeds of $128,459 and issued 17,432,879 shares. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

shares. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

ranging from $5.24 to $5.44 for a value of $1,023, including any cash consideration; and, </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="justify">Throughout the period, 522,733 shares were issued in accordance with the restricted share unit plan to
employees. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>19.</B></TD>
